title: One of the Cool Kids
text:
Viceroy is considered one of the cool kids in the hotel industry, and their spot in Manhattan is a great location, right on 57th between 6th and 7th. As with all things in New York City, space is at a premium and they make from what they've got. This is true of the Viceroy as well.
Furnishings are low and sleek, lots of warm brown leather, bold art and mirrors – and it works. There’s a pretty great rooftop bar, which was surprisingly spacious and uncrowded for drinks with the after-work crowd on a Tuesday evening. The views of Midtown skyrises and Central Park are awesome. Impressive selection of brown liquors for us scotch drinkers, so I was happy.
My room was tiny but efficient, and certainly comfortable if the bed is your main concern. There are no closets, which was weird, and instead they installed built-in cabinets around the bed. Yet, this room worked for me. The bed was really comfortable, and the little desk area served its purpose when I needed to get some work done.
Big plus: the staff was awesome – really outstanding. From the moment I checked in until I left, they impressed me with their comfortable service, grace and humor. The concierge, front desk, doormen and housekeeping were all authentically friendly and accommodating.
